Posts.Content: Can't see where to add a post without it being a direct reply to another post on new site, anyway, I am really struggling not knowing which way my treatment plan will go now. I know it was my choice to sign up to OPTIMA trial with a very slim chance this may mean no chemo, but waiting for the news is driving me mad. I was told I would know by today! At least I now have a date for chemo which is 24th, so that's something. Had a wig fitting today which was horrible, and got a haircut booked for Saturday, no idea how short to go yet. Not knowing is awful and it's strange but I kinda want to get on with next phase of treatment now, enough waiting - it means the end is closer too hopefully - hospital said they will hopefully hear by end of today what the verdict is, so waiting now ... nothing is easy about any of this. sash70

Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I had my first oncology appointment last week, following surgery (mastectomy and full auxillary node clearance) in May and have been feeling wobbly ever since because it brought up anxiety about the treatment and its side effects and also thoughts about recurrence I hadn't even begun to think about as they go through different outcomes with you. I signed up to the OPTIMA trial, so there's a small chance my treatment plan may not involve chemo, but having thought this was a done a deal, I am now in limbo awaiting news of what the treatment will involve and although my choice to take part in trial, it's tough not knowing. And it's tough thinking about the effect not only on me, but on my partner and my son who still lives at home. Losing my hair is my biggest hurdle and I know it seems minor in the grand scheme of things, I can't help feeling it's like one ask too many with all this following the surgery. Has anyone out there tried the cold cap? All the best to you all Sash
